meanings.definition: To last or continue for a long time.
meanings.sent1: The old castle will dure for centuries to come.
meanings.sent2: The friendship between them did not dure beyond high school.
meanings.sent3: Despite its age, the clock managed to dure through the years.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music will dure through any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day will dure in my heart forever.

meanings.sent1: She had to dure the pain of losing her pet.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers must dure tough conditions during training.
meanings.sent3: The little plant managed to dure the harsh winter.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship could dure any disagreement.
meanings.sent5: He had to dure the long wait for his turn.

meanings.sent1: The dure metal gate kept intruders out.
meanings.sent2: The dure rock formation stood strong against the wind.
meanings.sent3: The dure suitcase survived the rough handling at the airport.
meanings.sent4: His dure resolve never wavered in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The dure fabric of the tent protected them from the rain.
